English Content:
Keep the constant company of the Sant. 
Abandon [your] arrogance and drink the loving nectar in the form of discourses from the mouth of the Sant…1
Destroy your inner guile, and give your mind to him…2
Worldly misery ends and all sins are burnt when all our actions happen for him…3
Brahmanand Swami says, “Keeping the association of the Sant will give us the best fruits from life.”…4

English Content:
In the world, the Sant is our utmost benefactor. 
He takes us towards Bhagwān and gets rid of our illusions…1
He is compassionate to every living being; he removes suffering just like Bhagwān…2
He is a renunciant above the three gunas. His style is different from this world…3
Brahmānand Swami says, “By associating with the Sant, one finds Bhagwān himself.”…4
Gujurati Content:
સંત પરમ હિતકારી, જગત માંહી... ꠶ટેક

Transliteration Content:
Sant param hitkārī, jagat māhi...
Prabhupad pragaṭ karāvat prīti, bharam mīṭāvat bhārī... jagat 1
Paramkrupālu sakal jīvan par, harisam sab dukhhārī... jagat 2

Brahmānand kahe santkī sobat, milat hai pragaṭ Murārī... jagat 4

English Content:
Forsake all [your] arrogance. Bind [your] mind strongly to Bhagwān. Give up [your] regard towards the public opinion. Increase [your] love towards sadhus…
Those who associate themselves with sadhus defeats their pains of lust, etc. [The sadhus] take that person’s mind and attach it to the feet of Bhagwān… 1
In this way, one becomes great by worshipping Bhagwān. Their pains of births and deaths are destroyed. Their mind never again wanders elsewhere… 2
Dhruv, etc. achieved immortality by serving Bhagwān. [You] should take their advice to heart. [You] should also worship Bhagwān like them… 3
Stay away from bad people. Never see faults in the devotees of Bhagwān. Muktanand Swami says to remain as a servant of servants… 4

Oh sister, listen to the method of pleasing Shri Hari. Bhagwān has an intense enmity towards ego. The way a snake’s poison ruins sweet-milk, ego ruins all spiritual practices in a second… 1
Stay as a servant of the merciful Bhagwān. If you get a chance to offer even menial service, consider it to be your great fortune; Since, even Shiv, Brahma, and others do not get such a chance to sit next to Purushottam… 2
Daily, renew your love towards Purushottam Bhagwān. Do not feel jealous upon seeing others being honored; Serve Muktanand Swami’s Bhagwān (Shriji Maharaj) with elation. Then, Bhagwān will be pleased with you… 3

Transliteration Content:
Sāmbhaḷ benī Hari rījhyāṇī rītḍī,
 Mohanvarne mān sangāthe ver jo;
Sādhan sarve mān bagāde paḷ vishe,
 Jem bhaḷiyu paysākarmā ahi-jher jo... sāmbhaḷ 1
Dāsī thaī raheje tu Dīndayāḷnī,
 Nīchī ṭel maḷe to māne bhāgya jo;
Bhav-Brahmādikne nishche maḷtī nathī,
 Purushottam pāse beṭhānī jāgya jo... sāmbhaḷ 2
Prīt kare Purushottam sāthe nitya navī,
 Dājhīsh mā dekhī ke’nu sanmān jo;
Muktānandnā Nāth magan thaī sevjo,
 To rījhe rasiyo sundarvar kahān jo... sāmbhaḷ 3

English Content:
Then Shri Hari said, listen all devotees – men and women; I want to tell you all something… 1
My murti, my abode, actions and muktas are all divine… 2
My abode is called Akshar or Amrut; It is full of all powers, virtues, and capabilities… 3
Even the radiance of countless suns and moons are insignificant before it; It is cool, peaceful, and full of divine light. That light has no comparison… 4
In it I stay, with a two-armed, divine form (i.e. a human form); My darshan is rare even for the devs and my glory is limitless… 5
All jivas, ishwars, maya, kal and Pradhan-purush are under my control; I am Bhagwān, the inspirer of all… 6 
I create, sustain, and destroy countless worlds. Without my wish, nobody can break even a blade of grass… 7 
All my male and female devotees should understand me in this way; Before you, I have described the truth… 8 
For you I have come from Akshardham and assumed this human form. Premanand Swami’s Bhagwān has showered much nectar… 9

Also, listen to my talk which is supreme and incomparable; it is the highest principle and gives peace and happiness to all… 1
All devotees who want to go to my abode should serve me with pure feelings and without other desires… 2
All devotees who want to stay near me should shun their desires for perishable material pleasures… 3
Apart from me, know everything else to be maya; break your attachments to family and relatives knowing them to be false… 4
All of you sincerely obey my niyams; if you do so, Dharma and Bhakti (my parents; also, righteousness and devotion) will be pleased and protect you… 5
He delivered this message of instruction to all the sadhus and devotees; He did so in a human form whilst performing various gestures with his hands… 6
Just as all medicinal herbs are nourished by the full moon, he showered nectar-like blessings upon his devotees… 7
Amongst the sadhus, he stands out like the moon amongst the stars; God has manifest in Kali-yug to fulfil the work of all… 8
Premanand Swami’s master (Shriji Maharaj) will look after anyone who lovingly learns, sings, or listens to these words… 9

Today, my good fortune has come to fruition. Infinite souls have been liberated. There is no debt regarding my liberation. I have attained the manifest form of Bhagwān… 1

I can no longer be called an orphan. I have a protector who is with me forever. I have no fear from any other deities because Bhagwān has taken my hand… 2

No one can call me poor. I am experiencing eternal bliss. Pain has run away from my body and energy runs through it… 3

Ignorance has gone away and I have understood the truth. My weak efforts have disappeared, and I have met Shri Hari himself… 4

There is nothing lacking in anything [in my life]. I have attained Prabhu himself. My deficiencies are removed, and I am fulfilled. This feeling is everlasting… 5

By meeting Bhagwān, something great has occurred. This time I succeeded. What can I say for the limits of my happiness? I have infinite bliss!... 6

Today, I am welcoming happiness. I cannot fit the happiness in my heart! I have attained that which was unattainable. What can I say about the limits of this happiness!... 7

Today, it is raining nectar. There is nothing missing [anywhere]. What can I say about the liberation of one? [Today], millions have been liberated!... 8

I am no longer a beggar. Do not call me such! I am not poor. I have found the greatest wealth!... 9

Who knows how this happened? I have attained unfathomable happiness. Divine bliss flows over me because I have met Bhagwān face-to-face… 10

Today is a great festival in which I met Maharaj. Today, Nishkulanand Swami’s bell rings with victory!... 11

One who does not abandon their firm resolve (to please God) is considered in this world to be a truly brave person. They are not shaken from their resolve by pain caused by nature, deities, or svabhavs... 1
They act fearlessly and with patience in their mind. They have no doubts (fears) regarding the negative effects of time, karma, etc... 2
They have fixed in their mind: I will die one day, sooner or later. They do not have a cowardly mind that is tempted by the pursuit of worldly happiness… 3
After understanding [the truth], they have tied a firm knot in their souls; even if I lose my head (i.e. die), I will not give up... 4
They do not harbor the doubts of other individuals. They do not forget Brahmanand Swami’s beloved (Shri Hari) for even a moment... 5

The anubhavi (enlightened) person enjoys the bliss of Parabrahman. That living, enlightened, yogi is pure from the inside… 1
Whatever they hear or see, they understand it all to be made from maya. They understand that, and everything [else] formed in their mind, to be false… 2
They understand the vast expanse of the world to be like a mirage. [Knowing this], that great sage is not infatuated anywhere. They see the world like a dream… 3
No one understands the cause of this world. Muktanand Swami says that a person who is gurumukhi (lives according to wishes of their guru) experiences happiness… 4

Transliteration Content:

 Jīvanmukta jogiyā antar arogī re... anu 1

English Content:
This rare, expensive, birth will not be [easily] attained again.
So, shun your ego and worldly status and worship God; Otherwise you will continue in the cycle of births and deaths… 1
You will not be able to cross the great ocean of misery; But by surrendering at the feet of God, you will be liberated… 2
Shamelessly, you submerged yourself in worldly chores and never spared time [to worship God]; Craving after worldly pleasures, you never sat still… 3
Be aware, resolve your mind, and proceed cautiously; Lovingly worship Devanand Swami’s Lord (Shri Hari)… 4

The true sadhu is the wonderful abode of virtues. Understanding this, do satsang… 

The sant is filled with good qualities. There is not the slightest fault in his heart. That sage is truly experienced. He gives everyone true advice… 1
The sant always remains cool (at peace). He is never disturbed or bound by the nets of lust or anger. He has renounced all greed and worships Bhagwān. He firmly holds Bhagwān in his heart… 2
Even if [the sant] were to receive the wealth of all the realms, he would never give up his meditation of Bhagwān for even half-a-second. He is brahmarup and worships Bhagwān. For such a sant, mud and gold are equal… 3
Recognizing [the sant] according to these pure qualities, constantly do his seva. Understand him to be equal to Bhagwān. Muktanand Swami says, “He will liberate you instantly…”… 4

From the moment you are born, understand that death is guaranteed. What did you bring when you came, what will you take when you leave?… 1
The day begins and the night falls. Day after day passes [in this way]. Today, tomorrow, etc. – in this way, our lives shorten and pass… 2
One [person] is born and one [person] dies. No one is stable here. Those who die are reborn, and those who are born are born to die… 3
The entire world is food for death. All men and women are slaves to their actions. Narayanbhai says to everyone, “Perform actions after thinking them through.”… 4

That sant who is not controlled by his body, senses, and mind – that sant is always dear to me.… 1
That sant who never gives in to anger, greed, or lust. That sant who meditates upon me (Maharaj) and does my bhajan. That sant who never renounces me and goes elsewhere. [That sant is always dear to me.]… 2
That sant who knows Akshar, and that which is beyond Akshar, in his heart. That sant, who despite being full of all virtues and wisdom, has no ego. [That sant is always dear to me.]… 3
That sant who understands his form as the atma beyond the body and this world. That sant who constantly sings my (Maharaj’s) praises. [That sant is always dear to me.] Muktanand Swami says, “Maharaj has said, ‘That type of a person is a sant.’”… 4

Oh Narad! There is no one greater to me (Maharaj) than the sant. The sant is my heart and I am the heart of the sant. I constantly stay within him… 1
Lakshmi offers devotions to me renouncing her ego and restlessness. She resides upon my heart. However, she is still not equivalent to the sant… 2
For the benefit of the sant I would do anything. I would provide him shade with my hands. If someone were to pain him in the slightest, I would destroy that person from the root!… 3
Whoever has a human body and does not serve the sant, that person is a waste for their mother (i.e. their birth was a waste). Muktanand Swami says, “Maharaj has said, ‘That un-infatuated sant is my beloved.’”… 4

Oh Santo! It is difficult to become a servant of Bhagwān. You must renounce all desires for bodily happiness (i.e. that is how you become Bhagwān’s servant)… 
[You must behave] the way brave soldiers go into war with their hearts full of enthusiasm. Stab yourself in the stomach and march ahead (meaning, never think about retreating). Then, what fear remains?… 1
Cowards think, “We will stand on the side [during the war]. In the process, if we are at risk, we will instantly surrender.”… 2
Brave men and the sant are similar in that they destroy their enemies. [The sant] defeats lust, anger, greed, and infatuation. He lovingly offers devotion to Bhagwān… 3
A devotee who tolerates the abuse of the world is a [true] devotee of Bhagwān. Nishkulanand Swami says, “Other than that devotee, others can never be trusted.”… 4

English Content:
Oh Santo! Why should we act like beggars when we have found something of such great value (Maharaj)?… 
Attaining Purushottam Parabrahman Bhagwān, there is not the slightest thing lacking. Understand yourself to be extremely lucky and speak with passion… 1
The King’s Queen acted like a beggar. The King realized the Queen was an embarrassment and angrily had her removed. (Based on a Yogiji Maharaj’s tale of wisdom)… 2
Similarly, after becoming a devotee of Bhagwān, [imagine] if one stays lost in the sense-pleasures. Such a person protects himself by [pretending] to have devotion; however, they should really be understood as destitute… 3
Understanding them to be insignificant, one should renounce all the pleasures of the body and the mind. Nishkulanand Swami says, “[Only] such a person is a true devotee of Bhagwān. Others are like mere vegetables in the market (i.e. they are ordinary)!”… 4
Transliteration Content:

 santo shīdne rahīe re kangāl;
Jyāre maḷyo mahā moṭo māl re,
 santo shīdne rahīe kangāl...
Pūraṇ Brahma Purushottam pāmī,
 khāmī na rahī ek vāl;
Amal sahit vāt ocharvī,
 mānī manmā nihāl re... santo 1
Rājānī rāṇī bhamī bhīkh māge,
 hāle kangālne hāl;
Ghar lajāmaṇī rāṇī jāṇī rājā,
 khījī pāḍe vaḷī khāl re... santo 2
Tem bhakta Bhagwān nā thaīne,
 rahe vishaymā behāl;
Te to pāmar nar jāṇvā pūrā,
 haribhaktinī dharī chhe dhāl re... santo 3
Tan man āsh tajī tuchchh jāṇī,
 kādhu samjī e sāl;
Nishkuḷānand e bhakta Harinā,
 bījā bajārī bakāl re... santo 4

English Content:
A loving devotee wins over Bhagwān – who is both handsome and the giver of bliss. Bhagwān is not pleased by caste or beauty, he only loves devotion… 1
Love (devotion) cannot be found in this country or another. It cannot be bought in the market. Only one who offers their head (life) to balance the scales can become a loving devotee… 2
King Parikshit heard about the love [of the Gopis]. He misinterpreted it. Shukdev understood what happened and changed the topic. Shukdev then spoke to him about how to achieve moksha… 3
In comparison to the love of the Gopis, millions of Kabirs are like nothing. Muktanand Swami says, “One who understands that path of love is an intelligent sant.”… 4
Transliteration Content:

Prem na nīpje desh videshe,
 prem na hāṭe vechāy re;

 mokshnī rīt kahī dīdhī re... premī 3

 uḍyā koṭi Kabīrā re;
Muktānand e premno mārag,
 samje te sant sudhīrā re... premī 4
